definitions: exist in a particular place or situation at a given time
possess a particular quality characteristic or state of being
equal represent or serve as something in a particular context
examples: There will be a meeting tomorrow at three o'clock
The keys should be on the kitchen counter somewhere
She wants to be a doctor when she grows up
The weather has been quite cold lately this winter
Two plus two will always be four in mathematics
This painting could be worth millions at the auction

definitions: possess own or hold something as a belonging or characteristic
experience undergo or be affected by a particular state or condition
perform or engage in a particular action or activity
examples: They have three children and two dogs at home
Does your new phone have a good camera on it
She had a terrible headache all day yesterday at work
We had such a wonderful time at the beach resort
Let's have dinner together sometime next week if possible
I need to have a serious talk with my supervisor

definitions: perform carry out or execute a particular action or task
complete finish or accomplish something that needs to be done
be adequate sufficient or satisfactory for a particular purpose
examples: What did you do during your summer vacation last year
She does yoga every morning before going to work
Have you done your homework for tomorrow's math class yet
We need to do the laundry before we run out
Will ten dollars do for buying lunch today downtown
This old computer will have to do until next month

definitions: express communicate or convey something using spoken or written words
indicate show or give information about something without using words
suppose assume or imagine something for the sake of argument
examples: What did the teacher say about our test results today
She always says exactly what she thinks about everything
The clock says it's already past midnight right now
The weather forecast says rain for the entire weekend
Let's say you won the lottery what would you do
Say we leave at eight will we arrive on time

definitions: move travel or proceed from one place to another location
leave depart or move away from a current location
function operate or work in a particular way or manner
examples: We go to the farmers market every Saturday morning together
The train goes directly to the city center station
I have to go now or I'll miss my appointment
When does your flight go to Paris tomorrow morning
How does this new coffee machine go exactly anyway
The old car still goes despite its age and mileage

definitions: obtain receive acquire or come to have something in possession
become turn or change into a particular state or condition
understand comprehend or grasp the meaning of something
examples: Where did you get those beautiful shoes from yesterday
Can you get me a glass of water please
It gets really cold here during the winter months
She's getting better at playing the piano every day
I don't get why he's so upset about this
Do you get what the professor is trying to explain

definitions: have the ability skill or capacity to do something
be allowed or permitted to do something by rules or authority
preserve food or other items by sealing in airtight containers
examples: She can speak five different languages fluently without effort
Can you swim across the lake by yourself safely
You can park here for two hours maximum today
Students can use the library until ten o'clock tonight
My grandmother used to can tomatoes every summer season
We need to can these peaches before they spoil completely

definitions: have information knowledge or awareness about facts or situations
be familiar or acquainted with a person place or thing
recognize identify or distinguish someone or something from experience
examples: Do you know what time the store closes today
I know the answer to that difficult math problem
She knows everyone in her neighborhood by their first name
He knows Paris like the back of his hand completely
I would know that voice anywhere in the world instantly
You'll know the right house by its red door

definitions: express future actions events or states that are going to happen
express strong determination intention or willingness to do something
a legal document declaring a person's wishes after their death
examples: The package will arrive by tomorrow afternoon at latest
It will rain heavily throughout the entire weekend unfortunately
She will succeed because she never gives up trying
I will finish this project no matter what happens
My grandfather left everything to charity in his will
The lawyer read the will to all family members present

definitions: express hypothetical conditional or imagined situations and their consequences
express repeated actions or habits that occurred in the past
make polite requests offers or express preferences in formal situations
examples: I would travel more if I had extra money
What would you do in my situation right now
Every summer we would visit our grandparents at the farm
She would always bring cookies to share with everyone
Would you mind closing the window for me please
I would like to order the salmon with vegetables

definitions: create produce or construct something from materials or ideas
cause something to happen or force someone to do something
earn gain or acquire money through work or business activities
examples: She loves to make jewelry from recycled materials creatively
Let's make dinner together using fresh ingredients from garden
Don't make me laugh while I'm drinking coffee please
The loud noise made everyone jump in surprise suddenly
How much money does a teacher make per year here
This investment could make you wealthy over time potentially

definitions: use one's mind to form thoughts ideas or mental images
believe suppose or have as an opinion about something
consider contemplate or reflect carefully about something before deciding
examples: I need time to think about your interesting proposal
What do you think when you see the stars
I think she's the best candidate for this position
Do you think it will rain later this afternoon
Think carefully before you make any important decisions today
Let me think about it and call you tomorrow

definitions: perceive or observe something using one's eyes or vision
understand realize or become aware of something through thought
meet visit or spend time with someone socially or professionally
examples: Can you see the mountains from your bedroom window
I see a beautiful rainbow after the storm passed
Now I see why you were upset yesterday afternoon
Do you see what I mean about this problem
I'll see you at the coffee shop tomorrow morning
The doctor will see you in about fifteen minutes

definitions: move or travel toward the speaker or specified location
arrive at or reach a particular place or destination
occur happen or take place at a particular time
examples: Come here and look at this amazing sunset view
The children came running when they heard ice cream
What time did they come to the party last night
Spring comes early in this part of the country
Christmas comes once a year in December every time
The opportunity may never come again in your lifetime

definitions: grasp hold or carry something from one place to another
require need or use a particular amount of time or resources
accept receive or choose something that is offered or available
examples: Please take these books to the library for me
She took my hand and led me through the crowd
This project will take at least three months to complete
Learning a new language takes patience and daily practice
I'll take the blue shirt in size medium please
He decided to take the job offer in Seattle

definitions: have a desire wish or feeling of needing something
need or require something for a particular purpose or reason
lack be without or be deficient in something necessary
examples: I want to learn how to play guitar someday
What do you want for your birthday this year
This plant wants more sunlight to grow properly here
The old house wants a fresh coat of paint badly
The essay wants a stronger conclusion to be effective
Your argument wants evidence to support its main claims

definitions: express ability or possibility that existed in the past
indicate something that is possible or might happen under circumstances
make polite requests or suggestions in a formal manner
examples: When I was young I could run very fast
She could speak French before she moved to England
It could rain later so bring an umbrella today
This could be the solution we've been looking for
Could you please pass the salt across the table
Could I borrow your pen for a quick moment

definitions: direct one's eyes or gaze toward something to see it
have a particular appearance or give a certain impression
search for or try to find something or someone
examples: Look at the beautiful sunset over the ocean tonight
She looked directly into his eyes while speaking honestly
You look tired after working such long hours today
That dress looks perfect on you for the wedding
I've been looking for my keys all morning everywhere
We need to look for a new apartment next month

definitions: employ something for a particular purpose or to achieve something
consume expend or exhaust resources materials or supplies
take advantage of someone or something for personal benefit
examples: Can I use your phone to make a quick call
We use solar panels to generate electricity at home
Don't use all the hot water before others shower
This recipe uses fresh herbs from our garden exclusively
He felt his friends were using him for money
Don't let people use your kindness against you ever

definitions: communicate information facts or stories to someone through speech
distinguish identify or recognize differences between things or people
order instruct or command someone to do something
examples: Please tell me about your vacation to Italy recently
She loves to tell stories to her grandchildren nightly
Can you tell the difference between these two paintings
I can't tell which twin is which without looking closely
The teacher told us to finish our homework by Friday
Don't tell me what to do with my life

definitions: discover or locate something or someone after searching or by chance
realize determine or become aware of something through experience
consider judge or regard something or someone in a particular way
examples: I finally found my missing wallet under the couch
Can you help me find a good Italian restaurant nearby
Scientists found that exercise improves mental health significantly overall
We found the movie to be quite disappointing unfortunately
I find it hard to wake up early on weekends
The jury found him guilty of all charges yesterday

definitions: transfer the possession or ownership of something to someone
provide supply or furnish someone with something they need
yield produce or emit something as a result or reaction
examples: Please give this letter to your mother for me
She gave him a beautiful watch for his birthday
The teacher gives clear explanations of complex topics daily
This charity gives food to homeless people every weekend
Those flowers give off a wonderful fragrance at night
The old floorboards give under heavy weight or pressure

definitions: require something as necessary essential or very important
lack want or be without something that is necessary
be obliged or required to do something by circumstances
examples: Plants need water and sunlight to grow properly outside
I need to buy groceries for dinner tonight urgently
The house needs major repairs before winter comes again
This soup needs more salt to taste better overall
You need to arrive early to get good seats
We need to talk about what happened yesterday seriously

definitions: express duty obligation or correctness in actions or behavior
express probability likelihood or expectation about something happening
give advice recommendations or suggestions about what is best
examples: Students should complete all assignments on time every week
You should apologize for what you said yesterday immediately
The package should arrive by tomorrow afternoon at latest
She should be home from work by now usually
You should try the chocolate cake here it's amazing
He should see a doctor about that persistent cough

definitions: engage in physical or mental activity to achieve a purpose
function operate or run properly as designed or intended
have the desired effect or achieve the intended result
examples: She works at a law firm downtown every weekday
I need to work on my presentation this weekend
Does your new phone work with your old charger
The elevator doesn't work so take the stairs instead
This medicine should work within thirty minutes of taking
Let's see if this solution works for everyone involved

definitions: make an attempt or effort to do or accomplish something
test sample or experiment with something to evaluate it
put strain on or severely test someone's patience or endurance
examples: I'll try to finish the report by tomorrow morning
She tried three times before succeeding at the task
Would you like to try this new cheese from France
Let me try on these shoes in size eight
Don't try my patience with your constant complaining please
This difficult situation really tries our friendship bond severely

definitions: allow permit or give permission for something to happen
rent or lease property to someone for money
leave someone or something alone without interference or disturbance
examples: Please let me help you with those heavy bags
Her parents won't let her go to the party tonight
They let their spare room to college students annually
We're looking to let our beach house this summer
Just let him be alone for a while today
Let the bread rise for another hour before baking

definitions: speak to someone by phone or shout to get attention
give a name or label to someone or something
summon request or order someone to come or do something
examples: I'll call you tomorrow morning about the meeting details
Someone called your name from across the crowded street
What do you call this strange fruit from Thailand
Everyone calls him by his nickname instead of Robert
The doctor will call you when the results arrive
They called a taxi to take them home safely

definitions: express possibility or probability that something might happen or be true
ask for or grant permission to do something politely
express a wish or hope that something will happen
examples: It may rain this afternoon according to the forecast
She may be late due to heavy traffic today
May I use your restroom before we leave here
You may enter the building after showing proper identification
May all your dreams come true this year ahead
May you have a safe journey to your destination

definitions: signify indicate or convey a particular sense or message
intend plan or have as a purpose when saying or doing
be unkind cruel or malicious in behavior toward others
examples: What does this ancient symbol mean in modern context
A red light means you must stop your vehicle
I didn't mean to hurt your feelings yesterday evening
She means to finish her degree despite the challenges
Don't be mean to your little sister like that
Why are some people so mean to animals unnecessarily

definitions: experience an emotion physical sensation or state of being
perceive or examine something through the sense of touch
have an opinion belief or intuitive sense about something
examples: I feel happy when I spend time with family
She felt sad after watching that emotional movie yesterday
Feel the fabric to see how soft it is
The water feels too cold for swimming right now
I feel that we should wait before making decisions
How do you feel about the new company policy

definitions: request information or an answer from someone about something
request that someone do or give something as a favor
invite someone to attend an event or go somewhere together
examples: May I ask you a personal question about yesterday
The student asked about the homework assignment due date
She asked for extra time to complete the project
Don't be afraid to ask for help when needed
They asked us to their wedding next summer abroad
He finally asked her out on a romantic date

definitions: speak or have a conversation with one or more people
discuss or speak about a particular topic or subject matter
gossip spread rumors or reveal secret information about someone
examples: Let's talk about your plans for the future together
The baby is starting to talk in complete sentences
We need to talk business before pleasure this time
The professor will talk about climate change tomorrow afternoon
People in small towns love to talk about others
Don't talk about our private matters to strangers please

definitions: retain possession of something or continue to have something
continue doing an action or maintain a state persistently
maintain something in a particular condition or position
examples: You can keep the book I've already read it
She keeps all her jewelry in a safe place
Keep walking until you reach the red building ahead
He keeps making the same mistake over and over
Please keep the door closed to maintain room temperature
We keep the garden looking beautiful all year round

definitions: go away from a place or person temporarily or permanently
allow something to remain in a particular state or position
bequeath something to someone or entrust someone with responsibility
examples: I have to leave for work in ten minutes
When did they leave the party last night exactly
Leave the window open for fresh air to circulate
Don't leave your dirty dishes in the sink overnight
She left her entire fortune to animal welfare charities
I'll leave this decision entirely up to you today

definitions: place move or position something in a particular location
express or state something using particular words or phrasing
invest money or place a bet on something
examples: Put the groceries on the kitchen counter please immediately
Where did you put my car keys this morning
How would you put this idea into simple words
Let me put it another way for better understanding
He put all his savings into the stock market
I'll put twenty dollars on the home team winning

definitions: find enjoyable agreeable or satisfactory and have positive feelings toward
having similar characteristics qualities or features as something else
used to introduce examples or comparisons of similar things
examples: I really like chocolate ice cream on hot days
Do you like living in the city or countryside
She looks exactly like her mother at that age
This tastes like chicken but it's actually tofu
I enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and camping regularly
Cities like Paris attract millions of tourists every year

definitions: give assistance support or aid to someone in need
make a situation better easier or more favorable
prevent oneself from doing something despite wanting to
examples: Can you help me carry these boxes upstairs please
She always helps elderly neighbors with their grocery shopping
This medicine should help reduce your pain levels significantly
A good night's sleep really helps with concentration abilities
I couldn't help laughing at his funny joke yesterday
She can't help worrying about her children's safety constantly

definitions: begin doing something or begin to happen or exist
cause something to begin operating functioning or happening
make a sudden involuntary movement from surprise or fear
examples: Let's start the meeting with everyone's weekly updates
Classes start at eight o'clock sharp every morning here
Can you start the car while I lock the door
This button starts the washing machine cycle automatically
The loud noise made everyone start in surprise suddenly
She started when someone tapped her shoulder unexpectedly yesterday

definitions: begin to be something or come to be in a state
suit flatter or look good on someone
happen to someone or something especially regarding fate
examples: She wants to become a professional chef someday soon
The weather is becoming colder as winter approaches quickly
That color really becomes you wear it more often
Such rude behavior doesn't become a person your age
I wonder what became of my old college roommate
No one knows what will become of the company

definitions: occur take place or come about especially without being planned
do something or be somewhere by chance without planning
befall or occur to someone as an experience or fate
examples: What happened at the meeting yesterday afternoon without me
Accidents happen when people aren't paying attention while driving
I happened to see your sister at the mall
If you happen to find my keys please call me
Whatever happens we'll face it together as a team
Something terrible happened to him during the war years

definitions: display present or make visible something to someone
demonstrate prove or make clear through evidence or argument
guide escort or conduct someone to a particular place
examples: Can you show me your vacation photos from Greece
The museum shows artifacts from ancient civilizations daily
These statistics clearly show an increase in sales revenue
Time will show who was right about this decision
Let me show you to your table right away
The usher will show you where to sit tonight

definitions: appear to be something or have a particular quality
give the impression of being or doing something
examples: You seem tired after your long journey here today
The task seems more difficult than we initially thought
It seems like rain is coming look at those clouds
She seems to enjoy her new job very much

definitions: express possibility that something could happen or be true
physical strength force or power to do something
express permission in very formal or old-fashioned contexts
examples: We might go to the beach if weather improves
She might be late because of traffic congestion today
The athlete showed his might by lifting heavy weights
The storm struck with tremendous might destroying everything nearby
Might I suggest a different approach to this problem
You might enter now the queen will see you

definitions: perceive or become aware of sounds through the ears
receive information news or communication from someone or somewhere
listen to and consider formally as in legal proceedings
examples: Can you hear that strange noise coming from outside
I heard beautiful music playing in the distance yesterday
Did you hear about the new restaurant opening downtown
I heard from John that you're moving to Seattle
The judge will hear your case next Monday morning
The committee will hear all complaints before deciding anything

definitions: accept that something is true or real without proof
have faith confidence or trust in someone or something
suppose think or assume something to be the case
examples: I believe everything she tells me about her past
Many people believe in life after death strongly
She believes in her team's ability to win championships
You have to believe in yourself to succeed fully
I believe he's arriving on the five o'clock train
We believe the meeting starts at two this afternoon

definitions: engage in games sports or recreational activities for enjoyment
perform music on an instrument or audio device
act a particular role in a theatrical or real situation
examples: The children play in the park every afternoon together
Do you want to play chess with me tonight
She plays piano beautifully at the local jazz club
Can you play that song again on your guitar
He plays the villain in the new action movie
Don't play the fool when you know the truth

definitions: move in a circular direction or cause something to rotate
change direction or cause something to face another way
change or transform from one state or condition to another
examples: Turn the key clockwise to unlock the door properly
The earth turns on its axis once every day
Turn left at the next traffic light intersection ahead
She turned her head to look out the window
The milk turned sour in the hot weather yesterday
His hair turned gray after years of stress

definitions: move at a speed faster than walking by taking quick steps with feet
be in charge of and make decisions about how something operates or functions
flow or move continuously in a steady stream like liquid
examples: She runs five miles every morning before work
The children ran across the playground laughing joyfully
My uncle has run the family restaurant for twenty years
Who will run the company after the founder retires
The river runs through the middle of our town
Tears ran down her face during the emotional speech

definitions: be alive or have life as opposed to being dead
reside dwell or make one's home in a particular place
spend one's life in a particular way or under conditions
examples: My grandmother lived to be ninety-five years old
These plants can live without much water or sunlight
They live in a small apartment near the university
Where did you live before moving to this city
She lives for her music and nothing else matters
We should live each day to its fullest potential
